titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hartt guest artists collection ARCH078
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Sean Parke in Dec. 2015. Revised by Amanda Talbot, July 2017.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-06-19 09:58:49 -0400.

change.item: Revised after reprocessing which separated photos into a separate series

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: Materials pertaining to guest artists at the Hartt School primarily in the 1960s and 70s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, biographical information, programs, newspaper clippings, and photographs of guest artists who visited or performed at the Hartt School primarily in the 1960s and 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series: I. Publicity and Planning Documents and II. Photographs.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Portions of the collection have been digitized and can be accessed at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu. Public access to the digital repository is limited to the University of Hartford Campus. Computers are available to the public at the Harrison Libraries. Off-campus access is available for University of Hartford students, faculty, and staff with their university email and password.

did.unittitle: Grande Ecurie Et La Chambre Du Roi
Hudson Valley Saxophone Quartet of West Point

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: All of the photographs in the collection have been digitized and can be accessed at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu. Public access to the digital repository is limited to the University of Hartford Campus. Computers are available to the public at the Harrison Libraries. Off-campus access is available for University of Hartford students, faculty, and staff with their university email and password.
